page.title: 08HISTORY OF CHURCH
page.content: The present church is not the first church in the glen, there have been many over the centuries.The ruins of the 2nd oldest Episcopal Chapel in Angus are still clearly visable. There have been three churches around the present site. The first was built in 1601, the second in 1665 and the present church around 1800 at a cost of Â£400. It was an extension church of Kirriemuir Parish until 1873 The churches denomination is {Church of Scotland.}Long ago it was united with Glen Clova Church. There was one minister in charge of both churches. He had to walk across the hills between the two churches.The walk is now called{The Minister's Walk and has become a popular tourist walk. In 1954 the churches of Cortachy and Memus where added to the group and the name The Glens Parish Church given.
